thread.title: Pine Bluff edges Springdale Har-Ber for top spot in AP poll
thread.title_full: Pine Bluff edges Springdale Har-Ber for top spot in AP poll

title: Pine Bluff edges Springdale Har-Ber for top spot in AP poll
text:
Pine Bluff edges Har-Ber for top spot in AP poll after Fayetteville falls By The Associated Press   6:31   6:31   
Subjects: 
Arkansas (508) 

The Pine Bluff Zebras are the new No. 1 team in the Arkansas Associated Press high school football poll. 
The Zebras edged Springdale Har-Ber by one point in this week's balloting among AP-member sports writers and broadcasters. Har-Ber had defeated last week's No. 1 team, Fayetteville, which fell to fourth. 
Cabot remained third in this week's poll. 
Pine Bluff beat Little Rock Hall last Friday, 35-0, while Har-Ber beat Fayetteville 47-43. This week, the Zebras travel to El Dorado while Har-Ber visits Fort Smith Southside. 
Pulaski Academy stayed fifth in this week's poll, while Greenwood remains sixth. Bentonville and Bryant switched places, with Bentonville now seventh, while Benton and Little Rock Christian round out the top 10. 
Pine Bluff also leads the Class 6A poll, PA is atop the Class 5A poll while Dardanelle, Lamar and Rison lead among the smaller schools. 
There are two top-five matchups in the lower classifications this week. In Class 4A, third-ranked Pulaski Robinson visits No. 1 Dardanelle, while in Class 3A, No. 2 Smackover is at No. 3 Camden Harmony Grove.
